name: symphyotrichum firmum
description: Shining Aster attracts many bee species. Its white or pale blue flowers can be up to 1.5 inches wide and bloom for about three months, from August to October.  These plants can grow anywhere from from 3 to 8’ in height. Because they spread by rhizomes, plants can form large colonies.  Shining Aster is also known as Aster firmus and S. puniceum firmus.
features: Pollinator Favorite: butterflies, bees and birds
